intro: Pedicularis nagaensis, commonly known as the Naga Beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
